verses.text: And it came to pass, when Samuel was old , that he made his sons judges over Israel.
Now the name of his firstborn was Joel ; and the name of his second , Abiah : \add they were\add* judges in Beer-sheba.
And his sons walked not in his ways , but turned aside after lucre , and took bribes , and perverted judgment. \p
Then all the elders of Israel gathered themselves together , and came to Samuel unto Ramah ,
And said unto him, Behold, thou art old , and thy sons walk not in thy ways : now make us a king to judge us like all the nations. \p

¶ But the thing displeased Samuel , when they said , Give us a king to judge us. And Samuel prayed unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 8.6 \ft displeased: Heb. was evil in the eyes of\f*

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Samuel , Hearken unto the voice of the people in all that they say unto thee: for they have not rejected thee, but they have rejected me, that I should not reign over them.

According to all the works which they have done since the day that I brought them up out of Egypt even unto this day , wherewith they have forsaken me, and served other gods , so do they also unto thee.

Now therefore hearken unto their voice : howbeit yet protest solemnly unto them, and shew them the manner of the king that shall reign over them.\f + \fr 8.9 \ft hearken…: or, obey\f*\f + \fr 8.9 \ft howbeit…: or, notwithstanding when thou hast solemnly protested against them then thou shalt\f* \p
¶ And Samuel told all the words of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* unto the people that asked of him a king.

And he said , This will be the manner of the king that shall reign over you: He will take your sons , and appoint \add them\add* for himself, for his chariots , and \add to be\add* his horsemen ; and \add some\add* shall run before his chariots.

And he will appoint him captains over thousands , and captains over fifties ; and \add will set them\add* to ear his ground , and to reap his harvest , and to make his instruments of war , and instruments of his chariots.
And he will take your daughters \add to be\add* confectionaries , and \add to be\add* cooks , and \add to be\add* bakers.
And he will take your fields , and your vineyards , and your oliveyards , \add even\add* the best \add of them\add*, and give \add them\add* to his servants.
And he will take the tenth of your seed , and of your vineyards , and give to his officers , and to his servants.\f + \fr 8.15 \ft officers: Heb. eunuchs\f*
And he will take your menservants , and your maidservants , and your goodliest young men , and your asses , and put \add them\add* to his work.
He will take the tenth of your sheep : and ye shall be his servants.
And ye shall cry out in that day because of your king which ye shall have chosen you; and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will not hear you in that day. \p
¶ Nevertheless the people refused to obey the voice of Samuel ; and they said , Nay; but we will have a king over us;
That we also may be like all the nations ; and that our king may judge us, and go out before us, and fight our battles.
And Samuel heard all the words of the people , and he rehearsed them in the ears of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said to Samuel , Hearken unto their voice , and make them a king. And Samuel said unto the men of Israel , Go ye every man unto his city.
